title: I KEEP GETTING PERMA BANNED!!! WHAT DO I DO?!?!?
body:
This is what you do...

1) Don't type in chat to flame others

2) Learn to mute other players

3) Don't play Ranked, it will work you up

4) Play a champion that can hard carry games (e.g. Yi or Jax) if the problem isn't you but your "trashy" team

5) If the problem is with you (most likely it is), get better

6) Learn to play champions with CC instead of asking to nerf  "Broken" champions (e.g. Jax, Zed, Twitch, Zoe), turns out that these "Broken" champions die hard to CC

7) DO NOT BE AFRAID TO DODGE IF YOU ARE PLAYING RANKED! (Better to lose 3 LP and 15 minutes than lose 20 LP and 30 minutes)

8) Make a point to take breaks frequently - a break every 2-3 games can do wonders to help relieve tilt.

You're welcome, I just saved you from a few bans and a broken heart...

Godspeed my friend! {{item:3117}} 
You have many games to play without getting banned!
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

EDIT: No.8 was added and is Umbral Regent's Idea

This kind of thread pops up regularly, but the problem with all this advice is that permabanned players don't understand it. Here's the thought process around each piece of advice:

0. Don't type in chat to flame others - I wasn't flaming. All I said was that my team is bronze trash and their mothers are hyenas. Those are just likely facts based on evidence. It's science. Riot can't ban me for science.

0. Learn to mute other players - I need to defend myself! It's my right! If I get mugged, should I just try not to listen to my attacker?

0. Don't play Ranked, it will work you up - The other modes are boring and meant for the children of hyenas (see above).

0. Play a champion that can hard carry games (e.g. Yi or Jax) if the problem isn't you but your "trashy" team - People say my champ can't hard carry but she totally can. The problem is my trashy team. My teammates are literally bonobos at a zoo. Literally. Every time. And that one time where I won with a score of 2/9 while the rest of my team had positive K/D? I carried that.

0. If the problem is with you (most likely it is), get better - The problem isn't me. I keep getting grouped with trolls, inters, AFKers, and bonobo hyenas.

0. Learn to play champions with CC instead of asking to nerf "Broken" champions (e.g. Jax, Zed, Twitch, Zoe), turns out that these "Broken" champions die hard to CC - It's not my fault that Rito James keeps making broken OP champs that counter what I play. I was playing Leona jungle and even at 6 with my full root and stun combo I couldn't stop the enemy jungler AT ALL. He just turned red and kept hitting me. Nerf Olaf and unban me.

0. DO NOT BE AFRAID TO DODGE IF YOU ARE PLAYING RANKED! (Better to lose 3 LP and 15 minutes than lose 20 LP and 30 minutes) - Why should I eat a dodge? My hyena bonobo troll inter teammates should dodge. I'm not dodging.

Don't listen to this guy, when you play a few games you warm up and you will play better each other game whereas If you take a break you kinda "forget" to play or you just don't play in your prime...

As World peace plz mentioned, I'm talking about relieving tilt. You don't have to take super long breaks (I've taken an especially long one to wind down after a last-day Ranked crunch), but taking breaks is a good way to keep yourself in a winning mood - especially if at the end of the third game you've managed to sum up a three-loss streak.

Just a small break, 1-4 hours, is good enough to destress and get past the tilt matches can cause. And I don't see how small to medium length breaks (a few hours, maybe a day) can accrue enough rust to count for anything.

Whereas, if you just try to grind out game after game after game - sure, you may be in the motion of playing League, but continually doing much of the same thing can wear you down. And at that point, you're not playing in your prime for another reason - fatigue at the very least, and _tilt_ and fatigue at the worst.

But, still, my advice is best taken with a grain of salt. What works for me may not work for the next guy. I do better if I have frequent breaks in my play-sessions, whereas someone else may do better once they pick up momentum. At the end of the day, you can't _totally_ discount my advice, just take it as it is.
Even just going to the kitchen for 10 minutes and grabbing a sandwich works wonders

> A better solution is to disable the enter key while in game into such time you feel like your teammates words in chat don't flare up your anger.

You'd still be playing angry - and that could lead to small mistakes that compound on others. Which is half of the benefit of taking a break - you can take the time to refresh, get a clear head, and come back into the game with a winning mindset.

One way to help if you are getting angry over games is to make it less competitive. 

Playing a goofy build (e.g. Hecarim with Predator rune) in blind mode usually helps after a tense ranked game.

It is a suggestion with its merits. Some people are (for lack of better words) sore losers, and giving that loss extra meaning (LP loss, being pushed down the ranked ladder, etc.) gives those people more bitterness in the event that they _do_ lose - which, whether they like it or not, is gonna happen sometime.

And, even for people who can accept losses, the principle of Ranked (proving skill, getting rewards, etc.) can still cause some stress.

The problem is that the game doesn't reward skill anymore, esp in solo que, its a roll of the dice with teammates or just stick to a pool of less than 10 champions out of 100+ to pick from b/c they are the only viable choices to hard carry.
